title: Brainstem dysgenesis in an infant prenatally exposed to cocaine.
abst: Many authors described the effects on the fetus of maternal cocaine abuse during pregnancy. Vasoconstriction appears to be the common mechanism of action leading to a wide range of fetal anomalies. We report on an infant with multiple cranial-nerve involvement attributable to brainstem dysgenesis, born to a cocaine-addicted mother.

We report on an infant with multiple cranial-nerve involvement attributable to brainstem dysgenesis, born to a cocaine-addicted mother.

Many authors described the effects on the fetus of maternal cocaine abuse during pregnancy.
Vasoconstriction appears to be the common mechanism of action leading to a wide range of fetal anomalies.
We report on an infant with multiple cranial-nerve involvement attributable to brainstem dysgenesis, born to a cocaine-addicted mother.
